title: Risk Assessment
description: Identifying and managing security risks to systems and CUI

questions.question: Do you periodically assess risks to your operations and CUI?
questions.context: Regular risk assessments identify threats, vulnerabilities, and potential impacts.
questions.examples: Annual risk assessment, threat analysis, vulnerability assessment, risk register
questions.followUp: When was your last risk assessment? How often do you assess? What methodology?
questions.discussion: Risk assessments identify threats and vulnerabilities, determine likelihood and impact, and guide security investments.

questions.question: Do you scan for vulnerabilities regularly and when new ones are identified?
questions.context: Vulnerability scanning finds weaknesses in systems before attackers do.
questions.examples: Weekly vulnerability scans, patch scanning, configuration scanning, authenticated scans
questions.followUp: How often do you scan? What tools? Do you scan everything? How quickly are findings addressed?
questions.discussion: Vulnerability scanning identifies weaknesses in systems, applications, and configurations that could be exploited.

questions.question: Do you remediate vulnerabilities based on risk assessments?
questions.context: Found vulnerabilities need to be fixed based on their risk level.
questions.examples: Patch management, configuration fixes, compensating controls, risk acceptance
questions.followUp: How do you prioritize fixes? What are your timelines? Any accepted risks?
questions.discussion: Remediation addresses identified vulnerabilities based on risk, with higher risks addressed more quickly.
